docs.lead_paragraph: How much mental health coverage will this provide? Will I be able to get coverage for a therapist or psychiatrist?E.M.

headline.main: Will the Law Increase Coverage of Mental Health Services?

docs.abstract: State-based insurance exchanges will offer a base package of benefits, including some mental health coverage.
docs.snippet: State-based insurance exchanges will offer a base package of benefits, including some mental health coverage.

headline.main: How Will the High-Risk Pool Differ From Current Pools?

docs.abstract: The new federal plan will offer less expensive coverage than existing state plans and will not impose the same income restrictions as Medicaid.
docs.snippet: The new federal plan will offer less expensive coverage than existing state plans and will not impose the same income restrictions as Medicaid.

docs.lead_paragraph: What exactly is a health insurance exchange? I have read much on this new law but have not seen this concept explained beyond the abstract. Is it a company? A nonprofit group? A state or federal government agency? Who sets it up, runs it and oversees it? Does it require membership? Does anybody really know? David Watching, Baltimore
docs.abstract: An insurance exchange is a marketplace available to those without employer-based insurance that sets standards for benefits packages.
docs.snippet: An insurance exchange is a marketplace available to those without employer-based insurance that sets standards for benefits packages.

docs.lead_paragraph: How does this bill affect health savings accounts? - Rita, California

headline.main: How Are Health Savings Accounts Affected?

docs.abstract: Starting in January 2011, over-the-counter drugs can no longer be reimbursed on a pretax basis from health savings accounts, and the penalties on unqualified distributions will increase.
docs.snippet: Starting in January 2011, over-the-counter drugs can no longer be reimbursed on a pretax basis from health savings accounts, and the penalties on unqualified distributions will increase.

docs.lead_paragraph: Currently, pregnancy is pretty much considered an uninsurable pre-existing condition. How will the health bill affect women's ability to get reasonable maternity health care? Family Starter, San Francisco

headline.main: Will the Law Improve Access to Maternity Care?

docs.abstract: Beginning in 2014, the legislation will prevent insurers from excluding pregnant women from new plans, and health exchanges must offer benefits packages that include maternity care.
docs.snippet: Beginning in 2014, the legislation will prevent insurers from excluding pregnant women from new plans, and health exchanges must offer benefits packages that include maternity care.

headline.main: Will We Save Money Through the Insurance Exchanges?

docs.abstract: How much you pay on the state-run insurance exchanges will depend on your income.
docs.snippet: How much you pay on the state-run insurance exchanges will depend on your income.

docs.lead_paragraph: Does the legislation do anything to regulate premiums? If not, what's to stop insurers from simply raising premiums on sick people to unaffordable levels, effectively denying them coverage and defeating the purpose of reform? Chris, New York

headline.main: Will the New Law Lower Premiums?

docs.abstract: Employer-based plans are not affected, but plans offered through the state-run exchanges will not be able to increase premiums based on pre-existing conditions. The federal Department of Heath and Human Services will establish a rate review process.
docs.snippet: Employer-based plans are not affected, but plans offered through the state-run exchanges will not be able to increase premiums based on pre-existing conditions. The federal Department of Heath and Human Services will establish a rate review process.

headline.main: Can I Return to My Parents' Insurance Plan?

docs.abstract: Adult children can be added to their parents' insurance plan even if they were not previously covered under it, an expert said.
docs.snippet: Adult children can be added to their parents' insurance plan even if they were not previously covered under it, an expert said.

headline.main: When Must We Buy Health Insurance?

docs.abstract: The individual mandate does not go into effect until 2014.
docs.snippet: The individual mandate does not go into effect until 2014.

headline.main: How Soon Will the New Law Help Me?

docs.abstract: The answer depends on your age and reasons for not having insurance.
docs.snippet: The answer depends on your age and reasons for not having insurance.
